utterance.speaker: NOTE
utterance.content: To all Jewish House-fans, if you find any mistakes regard to anything Jewish in the following transcript, please leave a comment immediately. The Beta will take care of the rest.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: I don't know about you, but I'm nervous.

utterance.speaker: JEWISH GUEST
utterance.content: Mazel tov!

utterance.speaker: JEWISH LADY
utterance.content: Mazel tov. Many children.

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: Thank you, Mrs. Silver.

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: I know you chose well for me. I've been blessed.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Cross-species mating. I feel like Darwin in the Galapagos.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Amber and I have a lot in common.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: She's a Cutthroat Bitch. You cry over Dark Victory.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Bette Davis - another strong, assertive woman.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You don't like strong, you don't like assertive. You like needy.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: She's not dying, is she?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Yes. Go 'way.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I give it two months.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Hundred bucks.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Not really fair. You're not objective. But I'm all about the teaching...

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: We're at four months.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You hid this from me?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: I was wrong, okay? I thought you'd be upset. I thought you'd track me down in the hallways, and...

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You shouldn't have discounted the sex. She's obviously limber enough to put off the meltdown for two months.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: She's not needy. I don't need needy.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: She's scary. Why does Scary need Pathetic?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Are you gonna talk to her?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I don't see that I have any choice.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You all right with that?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: No impulse to save her from me?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: I've broken the pattern, House. Which is why this has a chance. I know you're too suspicious to accept that without getting out your ruler and your calipers and your scanning equipment. So, go ahead. Get it out of your system.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Thirty-eight-year-old female with loss of bladder control, blood in her urine and a broken leg from collapsing at her wedding.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Ampicillin for the UTI. Shiny cast for the leg. You guys know Wilson's dating Amber?

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Wilson and Amber?

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: I knew.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: I asked her out. Said she just started seeing someone.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Cultures were negative for UTIs. No signs of previous trauma or STDs.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Kidney cancer.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: CT was clean for tumors and kidney stones.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I thought Amber scared you guys.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: She does. But she also has legs that go all the way up to Canada.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: So do Canadians. Doesn't mean I wanna date one.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Her sodium's low. Could be endometriosis in the bladder.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Low sodium could also be from low food. Hasidic Jews fast on their wedding day.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Or... sodium was absorbed by a toxin already in her system. Was it just the legs? Or did you detect something resembling a soul?

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: She grew on me. If there's a toxin in her, could be carbolic acid. I'm talking about the patient now.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: That much carbolic acid, someone would've had to poison her.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Coulda been a Cossack. If this was eighteenth-century Poland and Cossacks were into household cleansers. Which is why it's more likely that the poisoner was "poisonee".

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Suicide's a sin.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Corollary of "people lie" is "people sin". In my world, "people" includes Jews.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: She was getting married.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Hasidic women marry young so they can start pushing out little Hasidilings. Thirty-eight means a woman not on anyone's hot-list. Being pushed onto a guy who's not on anyone's hot-list. No way out, no way out...

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Endometriosis fits better than an epiphany that her life is meaningless. We should start her on AIs and do a cystoscopy to confirm.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Check her innards for bad cells and her home for bad karma. Carbolic acid should be on her shelf, right next to the regret and the self-loathing.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: These people are crazy.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: Yeah, she should be self-hating.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: I'm not self-hating. I hate religious people who are out of touch with reality. You only marry someone you met three times, if they're carrying a little mistake.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: What's their divorce rate?

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Cleaners are all organic, nothing with carbolic acid. You like how they hook up?

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Values may give you the big picture, but time together gives you the little picture. Does she chew her food too loud? Will she leave you alone during the Final Four?

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: You commit to something deeper, you let the little surprises slide.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Surprises kill. Which is why I only commit when there are no more surprises.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: And you have no more surprises for your wife.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Do you think this came up on date number two?

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: You ever heard of a Hasidic Jew into hard rock? She's listed as a producer on all of these.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Where there's rock and roll, and sex... usually, there's drugs.

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: I'm Baalat tshuva. I became Hasidic about six months ago.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: And before six months ago? Music business isn't exactly known for its holiness.

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: Heroin. But I've been clean for months.

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: Yonatan knows. The broad strokes. He never actually asks the details. Says what's important is the person that I am now, not the person I was then.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: How do you go all the way from...?

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: Just took a class. Then I took another class.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: And you just completely left the music business?

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: Pop music is considered frivolous. Same reason we don't watch TV or go to movies.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Your drug use may have caused some long term damage. We're gonna need to take a hair sample to test for latent toxins.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: So you can never watch Star Wars again.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You figured that I'll hire you...

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: ... if you promised to dump Wilson.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: How did you...?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Wilson had a key.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You figure that I'll make your life hell at first, but I'll eventually see how good you are and keep you.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: It's a good plan, don't you think? Perfectly tailored to your personality.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: No, it's not. You know it's not. Means you just wanna stay in my orbit 'cause you figure I'll eventually realize that I made a mistake and you're gonna be able to rub my face in it.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: I can't wait. It's gonna be awesome.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: No, it's not. And you know it's not. 'Cause you know that even if I made a mistake, I'd never admit that I made a mistake. Which means that you're just toying with Wilson to toy with me.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Your goal is pure feral vengeance.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Innocent bystander, but there's a greater good.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: No, that's not it. Because a bag of flaming poop bypasses the bystander.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: So... which is it, House? Am I in this for you? Or am I in this for him?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Give him back his sweatshirt. 'Pit stains don't become you.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Treatment had no effect. Rules out endometriosis. And her hair sample was negative for residue drugs.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: This woman lived in the fast lane till six months ago. Maybe we're missing something.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: She admitted drug use. Doubt she's holding out on her days as an asbestos miner.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Cryoglobulinemia might account for the symptoms.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Except for the one you missed.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: There's no change in her condition.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm not talking about a new symptom. I'm talking about one that presented six months ago.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Look, she's nuts, but we can't just give her ten ccs of atheism and send her home.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Religion is a symptom of irrational belief and groundless hope. Altered mental status, on the other hand, is a symptom of porphyria.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: She didn't develop uncontrollable anger, crying, anxiety. She just decided to go to temple.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: The woman didn't _just_ choose to keep kosher. She went directly to the extremes of Hasidism, a life of stringent rules. She became a masochist.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: She didn't like her old life, so she changed it.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: People don't change. They might want to. They need to.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Taub gave up a six figure plastic surgery career for this job. That mean he has porphyria?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: He switched jobs to save his marriage. He did it to avoid change.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: He's right. You don't suddenly choose crazy without suddenly being crazy.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: No, no, if she walked away from everything to go base jumping or live with apes, we wouldn't be having this discussion.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: We would if she was also tinkling blood out of her overexcited bladder. Pump Hadassah full of hematin and give her a phlebotomy.

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: Bloodletting?

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Porphyria is a rare genetic disorder that causes an overproduction of a certain protein. Draining the blood relieves...

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: The hair test for damage from drugs showed she has a rare genetic disease?

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Not-not exactly. We're testing her now to confirm.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: You're treating it before you confirm it?

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Blood test results take twenty-four hours.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: You must have seen something that makes you suspect it.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Uhh, Dr. House has a theory.

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: A theory based on what?

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: We'd like a different doctor.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: I assure you that Dr. House is our best...

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: Then we will settle for second-best, someone who doesn't think my wife is sick just because she's religious.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: If you prefer, I can give your wife my second-best diagnosis.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: D'you know Wilson's dating Amber?

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: I have reviewed the chart. Someone on your team must have pointed out that cryoglobulinemia also fits the symptoms.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes, it fits _many_ of the symptoms.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: My wife's body is sick. Her mind and soul are fine.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You live according to God's six hundred commandments, right?

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: Six hundred thirteen.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You understand them all?

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: Takes a lifetime of learning...

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: But you follow the ones you don't understand because the ones you do understand make sense, and you believe that the guy who created them knows what he's doing.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: So you will trust my diagnosis and you'll let me treat her, because in this temple, I am Dr. Yahweh.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: I want a new doctor.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: I'm starting her on indomethacin for cryoglobulinemia.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: People don't change. For example, I'm gonna keep repeating "people don't change".

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: So alcoholics that successfully go through treatment don't exist.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: They're still alcoholics. If they never take a drink as long as they live, it's only 'cause they didn't live long enough.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: If you're dissatisfied with your life, changing it is a symptom of mental health.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: I get why that concept is strange to you...

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: O2 sats are 85. She's hypoxic. We might need to intubate.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: What's wrong with her?

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: It's definitely not cryoglobulinemia.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Better ask Him.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: We kept her on oxygen overnight.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Her respiratory rate stabilized, and her O-sat's back up to 95. Saw Amber drop off Wilson this morning.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes. The male always drives the female. So what caused the breathing problem?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Pulmonary involvement rules out porphyria.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: She kiss him or he kiss her?

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: I missed it. The lab tech with the tongue stud also pulled up.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: Wegener's would explain her elevated sed rate.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Wegener's wouldn't explain the changed mental status.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Actually, we've been trying to ignore that part of the whiteboard.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, I wrote it in black. I'm always serious when I use black. Lupus would explain...

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Maybe she didn't change.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Are you agreeing with me or you making a point?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: I'm making a point.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: That's gonna take longer.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: How do we know that the real Roz isn't who she is now and who she was then? Can't we say that her previous life was true without making her present one a fraud?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: "Life is messy" argument. Nice. Explains everything without explaining anything. If it's lupus, there's a heart problem we don't know about yet. Run her through a stress test. If she has a heart attack, I'm right.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Or we could wait. Hope that...

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You're afraid to give her a heart attack.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Of course we're afraid to...

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: No reason to be afraid. Unless you think I'm right.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: It's Wegener's.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: But we'll have the crash cart just in case.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh, my God! What are you guys doing here?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I had a sudden yen for Fusion.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: I put a different restaurant in my date book. I'm firing my assistant.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: That's okay. Hi, Greg. And I call you Greg because we're now social equals.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I call you Cutthroat Bitch... well, Quod erat demonstrandum. And I speak in Latin because I don't try to hide what an ass I am.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: I assume you'd like to join us? It'll be easier to observe our interaction if you're at the same table.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: If we ever get seated.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: No, no, I, uh...

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: We've been waiting for...

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Any minute now, she's gonna hit him in the face with your testicles.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: She tends to treat ev... She tends to treat every event like it's the last copter out of Saigon.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: She's the anti-Wilson. She's a force for evil.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: She has an annoying quality. Perhaps even two. If I was perfect, I would date perfect.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You like that!

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: It's annoying, but she's good at it.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Wait a second.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: This isn't just about the sex. You like her personality. You like that she's conniving. You like that she has no regard for consequences. You like that she can humiliate someone if it serves...

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh, my God. You're sleeping with me.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: I need you to go faster, Roz.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Little harder.

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: I am going harder, dammit.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: What if Dr. House was right? And Roz did make a radical change?

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Lupus is chronic but treatable.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: And with the treatment, it'd undo the change? She'll be the way she was before I knew her?

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: I don't think it's likely.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: Then you don't know for sure.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: You'd find someone else.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: There isn't someone else.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: You've had three dates.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: How long have you been married?

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Twelve years.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: And is she the one?

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: We wouldn't still be together if she weren't. I love her as much now as the day...

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: Well, you should love her more. The more you know someone, the more you should love them.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Okay, that's enough, Roz.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Your heart's as strong as a battleship.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: Does this mean Dr. House was wrong?

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: Oh! Oh, my leg!

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: Heart's strong enough to prove you wrong about the change in mental status.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Only proves this isn't lupus. Just as the leg pain proves it isn't Wegener's.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: Leg pain can be from nerve entrapment. We're thinking blood clot.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Do an MRI to look for the clot. Then do an fMRI.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: An MRI alone will detect...

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: If the clot hasn't dissolved. An fMRI can show signs of near-ischemic stroke in post-ischemic parts of the brain.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Gimme ten bucks.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I missed lunch.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: I thought you went...

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I missed lunch!

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Good symmetrical activity in both hemispheres.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: Caudal structures look okay. She hasn't changed? Sex, drugs, rock and roll, the six hundred rules of God are all in there somewhere.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: We oversimplify people. It's how the human mind works. Everything's on or off. Everything's got a... category.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: You don't like it. You don't wanna be... oversimplified. Roz, move your right leg.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: No one can describe themselves in ten words. Why would we wanna hear anyone else do it?

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: So you keep it a mystery. No categories if no one knows anything.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Do you think maybe you're oversimplifying me now?

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: No. I'm sure you have many reasons to keep yourself a mystery, besides the fact that you're bisexual.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: Uh, denial would have worked before the long, vacant stare. Roz, move your left leg just an inch.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: People who have a problem with boxes are people who don't fit in them.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: You've been working for House for a long time.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: No need for name calling.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: I would ask if this was gonna be lunchtime gossip, but lucky for me...

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: I don't give a damn.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: How's our Mental Yentl?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: MRI shows no sign of clots. fMRI shows no problem areas.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Go restart her IV.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: What's wrong with it?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Nothing. But like so many procedures we put patients through, it hurts. Which, if she's enjoying it, will show up in pretty colors.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: This is why you wanted an fMRI?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: It showed she didn't have a blood clot, which is diagnostically relevant. And it can show that she's become a masochist, also diagnostically relevant. And it'll be cool.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Either explain which part of my analysis didn't make sense. Or go do it.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: It isn't cool.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Heavens. Look at her limbic system. Pleasure centers are lighting up like a Hanukkah bush. Foreman must have a touch like an elephant.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Okay, Roz. We've got what we need.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes, it _was_ impressive.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Roz. You all right?

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: Oh, sorry. I was praying.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: All through the procedure?

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: No. When Dr. Foreman apologized, I knew something bad was gonna happen.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: She was praying. Could explain the brain activity.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: BP and heart rate are dropping. She's crashing!

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: She's stabilizing.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Get her up.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: All the way up. On her feet.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Make her do that again.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: We started her on fludrocortisone and ephedrine.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: It's Planet of the Apes. Apes are the humans, humans are the apes. It's Wacky Wednesday, Opposite Day.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: When you stand up, your BP and heart rate are supposed to go up, not...

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Got it.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: So what causes bloody urine, loss of bladder control, leg pain, altered mental status, and pressure-blood in direction-wrong?

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: Pheochromocytoma.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Low catecholamines in the urine means no pheochromocytoma in the Jewess.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Could be systemic sclerosis.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Mental status!

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: She was praying.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: She was in pain. You no longer think she's crazy?

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: I can... see why she'd be attracted... to that life.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You drank the Manishewitz-flavored Kool-Aid.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: I'm not saying I agree. I'm just saying...

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: That there's a rational basis for the irrational.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: They have something we don't have.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Imaginary friends.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: If the toaster's not working, wiring could be bad.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Which debate is that metaphor supposed to help us with?

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Electrical problem in the heart. Arrhythmia messes with the blood flow when she stands, causes low BP and heart rate. Could also impact mental status. Everybody's happy.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Run an EP study of her heart. Find where the wiring's verklempt.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Went by your hotel this morning. They told me you moved out. Moved in with CB?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: No, apparently, I moved in with you.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: The very fact that you're resisting my insight proves to me...

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: House, you're right. Why not? Why not date you? I-i-it's brilliant.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: We've known each other for years, We've put up with all kinds of crap from each other, and we keep coming back. We're a couple!

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Are we still speaking metaphorically?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Amber is exactly what I need and you would agree if you weren't mired in self-loathing topped with a thin crust of megalomania.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Hey. That's my best friend's girl you're talking about.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I was wrong.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: House, you're right.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: She's not me. Well, she is me. But that's... not why she's attractive. She's a needy version of me.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Hard to imagine such a mythical creature.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You started seeing her right after I fired her.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: I started seeing her four months ago.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: She told Kutner it was four weeks.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You lied to me. There was money on the line.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Because I knew how you'd react, and I knew you wouldn't pay me anyway!

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You knew that I was right.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: She wasn't needy. She was in a... bad situation. There's a difference.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Not to your libido.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Wait a minute. Why are you doing this? Every time I agree with you, you find a new argument. What are you trying to avoid?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Well, if you'd looked at me with those flashing eyes before I was involved... pfch! C'est la vie. And... I use the French because... you're an ass.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Right atrium normal, no arrhythmia.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: You can become a Dar master. Does that require further explanation?

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Right ventricle normal.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: In college, I was really into science fiction. Not like the guys with the six-hundred-dollar prosthetic ears who could swear in Romulan. That was embarrassing to the rest of us who just thought it was good, smart literature. Went to one convention. By senior year, I was Dar master in the Klingon Empire.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: I'm not gonna become Hasidic. I'm not even gonna become slightly more Reform. Coronary sinus normal.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: You can't have your eyes opened to something and not act on it.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: I haven't had my eyes opened. I just... don't think they're crazy anymore.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Then they have something to offer.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: She's living proof that sane people can make radical changes. But House, he thinks that he can bully...

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: No loshon hora.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: I'm sorry?

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: I think she's telling you to stop deflecting.

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: No loshon hora. Evil tongue. Gossip.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: 'S okay. Thanks to the sedative, you won't remember it.

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: Words are permanent. Someday you'll say something that you'll wish you could take back.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: His bundle's normal. Pathways are all clean. No arrhythmias.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: If the toaster doesn't work and the wiring in the house is fine, problem's gotta be in the city's power grid.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Autonomic nerve disorder could be Riley-Day syndrome.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Congratulations on your wedding. You have a rare and incurable degenerative disease.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: I'll set up for a thermoregulatory sweat test.

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: Bisexual.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: I could hear them talking from inside the MRI.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Hear who? I heard the word sex.

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: It was interesting.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: What was interesting?

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Doesn't matter.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: We're doctors. We never know what's gonna matter. She said sex.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: If she wants to tell you when she wakes up...

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Yeah, these people aren't gonna change you at all.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I need you to sleep with Wilson.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Good morning.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: He's involved with... an inappropriate woman.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: His people are sheep-herders and Amber's are... cattlemen?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: He's combined two of his worst qualities - his love for me and his love for need.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: As administrator of this hospital, you have to save your star oncologist.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Wish I could help, but as administrator, there are some people in Accounting I'm scheduled to sleep with first.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Wilson has a pattern with women. He saves them, then he betrays them. Which then causes guilt. Which then causes him to go save somebody else. For example, a hospital bureaucrat nearing forty who has no personal life. I suggest you go braless.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: I get that "sleep with" is your way of saying I should talk to him?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: No. I really mean "sleep with".

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: You're not worried this relationship will fail. You're worried it'll succeed. That Wilson will no longer be at your beck and call 24/7. That your best friend will change.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: People don't change just because they wish they could.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: And it bugs you that he wishes he could! You'll never lose your friend, House. You're the long-distance runner of neediness.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: As the chamber heats up, Roz's body temperature should also rise, making her sweat and turning the powder purple. No change in color means no sweating, which means her central nervous system is damaged.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: I shouldn't see her like this.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: We could have a diagnosis as soon as she comes out of the chamber. It might be better if you stayed.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: It's disrespectful. I'm sure she imagined the first time her husband would see her bare like this would be... celebrating the marriage?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Given the circumstances, I think Roz would sacrifice modesty to have you with her.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: Please. Don't do that.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: What? I-I think it's nice that you're here. I think...

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: You think it's sweet. That I care for her modesty, But that it's archaic and ultimately irrelevant.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: Our traditions aren't just blind rituals. They... they mean something. They-they have purpose.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: I respect my wife. And I respect her body.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Her body temperature's stopped climbing.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: What's going on?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: She's having a seizure! Need a crash cart!

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Blankets too! She's freezing!

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: She was supposed to sweat and she froze.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Return to the Planet of the Apes.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Hypothermia caused the seizure. What caused the hypothermia?

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Could be an infection.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Her white blood cell count was fine.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: When she was admitted. She coulda picked something up here.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: Complication on a complication?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Body's doing the opposite of what it's supposed to. Her body's Wilson. How do we respond to that?

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: We accept that he's happy.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: We do the opposite.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: So you want us to, what, send the patient home?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Infection... means that something's been added to the body, something that should be expelled. What's the opposite of that?

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Something missing from the body. Could be an enzyme or a hormone.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: Cortisol. Could be Addison's.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: It fits. Every symptom.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: I'll run a cortisol stimulation test.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Are you sure she doesn't wanna just take you back to her lair, hang you upside down, and deposit her eggs in you?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Excellent disguise, House.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: You two are really that serious?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: She's pretty. She's funny. Maybe she's a little more...

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: ... evil?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: ... aggressive than you'd expect from me. But... I'm happy. Can't I just enjoy what that feels like for a while?

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: How many people have looked at you trustingly while you gave them a fatal prognosis? But you knew it was kinder to tell them the truth. Amber compulsively looks out

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Wow!

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: That cortisol stuff is great. Does it work on everything?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: I take it you're feeling better.

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: Oh, still weak. But yeah.

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: You must be so tired. You should go home and get some sleep.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: I'll stay.

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: I never told you, but you are much better looking than Mrs. Silver led me to expect.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: She never liked me. When I was eight, I threw up on her shoes at my uncle's wedding.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Your abdomen is little swollen.

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: Mm?

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: Is it serious?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: It's hard to say. Sometimes it can mean a liver issue. We'll have to test.

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: Oh, oh, dizziness is getting...

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: She's going into shock! I need another liter of saline! Type and cross two units!

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: What's happening to her?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: She's bleeding internally.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: She's saying the Sh'ma. She thinks she's dying.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: The MRI shows you're bleeding internally, but not where it's coming from. The blood can only keep you stable for so long. Our best option is to open you up and search.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: But you can fix it?

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: If we find the leak.

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: You find the bleeding, you find the disease?

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: No. But it could keep you alive long enough so Dr. House can find what's wrong with you.

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: I don't wanna have the surgery.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: It's the only chance you've got.

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: I don't want to have the surgery until after sunset. I'm probably gonna die anyway. I just wanna share one Shabbat with my husband.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: Roz, please. The Torah commands us to preserve life.

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: I've waited thirty-eight years to find what I wanted. I can wait another eight hours. I'll leave the rest to God, okay?

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: I had a Rabbi call. She's adamant.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: She's not a masochist, she's suicidal. Nice work, Chase.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: Yeah... I should have had twin Rabbis call. Can I go?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: We need you.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: So, instead of a few days, we now have a few hours to figure this out. Nice work, Chase.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: Why do you need me?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Saying, "nice work, Chase" when you're not here is pointless.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Seriously, we need you.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: We should X-ray for malformations of the rib that could cause arterial twisting.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Malformations don't cause bloody urine.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: She's not suicidal. She made a commitment to a new life with her husband and she wants one meaningful experience in that life.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: She just met the guy.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Taub just met her and he's already so in love, he's ready to let her die and take her back to the home planet for a burial in the lava sea of Tormiac.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: It's who he might be. She's connecting with all the years she's not gonna have.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Better way of connecting to those years is to actually have them.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: You want more time?

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: Joshua got God to make the sun stand still. No reason God can't speed it up. And, by God, I, of course, mean you.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Told you we needed you.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: It's sundown, Roz.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: We're taking you back to your room for your candlelight dinner. Ready? One, two, three.

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: It's too early.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Your sense of time is off because of the medication.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: Good Shabbos, Roz.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: So you pray, scarf down some challah, then we can do this?

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: You wanted to see me?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: And you came.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: I feel pretty confident it'll be something interesting.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Solve this case and the job is yours.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Is there a "Drop Wilson" clause attached to this?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Standard contract all employees sign.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Why do you have to believe I have an ulterior motive?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: For the same reason I believe that crack whores can have sex... for crack.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: All my life I thought I had to choose between love and... respect. And I chose respect. And with Wilson... I know what it's like to have both. And that beats a fellowship.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Could be DIC.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You've changed.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: I hope so.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Normal platelet count rules out DIC. Good try though.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: Eishes chayil mi yimtza...

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: ... ve-rachok mi-peninim michrah.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: Dar’eshah tzemer u’fishtim...

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: I read that a hydatid cyst could...

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Would affect the lungs, not the bladder.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: Tested her white cell count again. Normal.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: How long till we get to cut her open?

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: When I left, he was still singing Eshet-something.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: The husband's blessing of his wife. He calls her Eshet Chayil.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: "Woman of valor". "Strength and honor are her clothing. She laughs at the future"...

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: ... because she's an idiot.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Volvulus of the small intestine could cause bleeding.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: She woulda had constipation. Her value isn't "beyond pearls" either. 'Cause dead people have no value.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Polycythemia vera.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: RBC count would be higher.

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: I need to bring the light to my face.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Thrombocytopenia. If it's autoimmune...

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: Titers were normal.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Parkinson's would explain the hypothermia.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Not the bloody urine. Woman's not just a masochist, she's a hypocrite.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: The commandment to preserve life comes before all others.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Actually, it means she's not a masochist. She's not following all the rules, just the ones that please her.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Right, she walked in crazy and explained how ritual trumps living, and you decide it's a beautiful lifestyle.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: I know. She's wrong.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: But if there's nothing more...

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Then the only meaning is here.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: But if she thinks God is there for her.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: If she lives her life believing that God is there...

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Then she dies.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Things aren't where we want them to be just 'cause we want them to be there.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: 'Course, that doesn't mean they're where they should be.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Hey! Stop that Jew!

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Chase hates working on Shabbos. Gonna make this easier for him. Stand her up.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: She doesn't do so well on her feet.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Neither do I. Stand her up.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You can tell all the ladies at the Mikvah about this.

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: What did you do?

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Put your hand here. Press hard.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You have nephroptosis. Also known as "floating kidney". The kidney's like a chandelier.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: It's attached to a ceiling of intestines and blood vessels. But your contractor - think you know who he is - he hung it with a cheap chain. It's been hanging sloppy for years.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Finally something shook it loose.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: After that, every time you stood, your kidney dropped a few centimeters, caused all your symptoms.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: None of the scans picked it up.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Because we do scans with patients lying down. She'd've been lying down in surgery too. We would never have found it. Good chance she'd never come out.

utterance.speaker: YONATAN ARNOFF
utterance.content: She'll be all right?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Ultrasound to confirm, then tell Chase to put the kidney back on the shelf. The bleed will be nearby.

utterance.speaker: ROZ VINER
utterance.content: That's... it?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Mazel tov.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Couple hours surgery, you'll be ready to push out those fourteen children.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You do it both ways, right?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: The ultrasound. You do it standing up and lying down.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: What else would I mean?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I've decided you could do worse than a female proxy for me.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: So you're going to acknowledge that people can change?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: You think I've changed or Amber's changed?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Then you've changed.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: If you do change, can it be the part of you that chases me down halls, trying to change me?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Do you know what this means?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: That you made one good dating choice. The fabric of the space/time continuum could unravel.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: My world could expand. I could form a long-term connection that isn't with you. And since you put the darkest possible construction on everything, you could end up losing a friend. You've thought of all this.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: And yet you're going along with it. Are you being... self-sacrificing?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I'll sacrifice... a lab rat. I'll sacrifice a fly. I'll sacrifice two hundred on a mudder at Monmouth Park. I don't sacrifice self.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Shabbat Shalom, Wilson.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Shabbat Shalom, House.
